page.title: 15Agriculture and Horticulture
page.content:
The Norfolk college of Agriculture and Horticulture
After the food rationing of the{2nd {World war,}the{Loveday Report of 1945 suggested that{every county}should have a college to{produce trained farm {workers.}The land in Easton was bought in{1949.}It was chosen because it was {central in Norfolk,}and available at the time. The{Horticulture}college is situated{17 miles}away at{Burlingham, but the statistics of this college is included in the data. The first students came in{1951,}and the college buildings were officially opened in {1953.
